title: Toaster in-game notification
shortdesc: A lightweight tool for seamless in-game notifications in Unity projects, offering customizable design, smooth animations, and easy integration with minimal resources.
description: The Toaster - InGame Notification Package for Unity is a versatile and lightweight tool designed to easily integrate pop-up notifications into Unity projects. This package enhances the user experience by providing customizable, time-controlled, and easing-based notifications without burdening your project with unnecessary resources. It leverages the TMP text component for crisp text display and offers a streamlined implementation process.
feature:
• Simplified Integration: Easy to integrate with just a few lines of code.
  • Enhanced User Experience: Provides smooth, in-game notifications that enhance player engagement.
  • Customizable Design: Fully customizable to match the design needs of your project, including optional parameters for titles, duration, and positioning.
  • Time and Easing Control: Control the duration and easing animations for notifications to match the flow of your game.
  • Lightweight and Compact: Minimal footprint, ensuring your project remains fast and responsive.
  • TMP Text Component Support: Utilizes TMP Essential Resources for high-quality text rendering.
  • Upcoming Features:
    • Event Emitters for Toast Lifecycle: Gain control over notification events with onStart, onDismiss, and onEnd callbacks.
    • Custom Color System for Toasts: Implement color-coded notifications for success, danger, and warning scenarios.

title: FlowchartAI
shortdesc: FlowchartAI is an advanced AI-driven flowchart builder that generates interactive flowcharts based on user instructions. It simplifies the process of creating and managing flowcharts, offering the flexibility to export the results in popular formats like PNG and SVG. Users can also save their flowcharts to their accounts for easy access and management. The tool currently supports two types of diagrams: Activity Diagrams and Schema Diagrams, with options to manually create, update, or delete flowcharts.
